text: New Jersey Board of Higher Education v. Shelton College, 90 N.J. 470 (1982), 448 A.2d 988, is New Jersey Supreme Court case regarding state regulation of religious schools which grant academic degrees. The Court held that religious schools are prohibited from granting degrees without a state license. == References == Category:New Jersey state case law Category:Supreme Court of New Jersey Category:1982 in United States case law Category:Law articles needing an infobox
title: New Jersey Board of Higher Education v. Shelton College
